Let $w = w_1 w_2 \dots w_n$ be a word. Define a \textit{substring} of $w$ to be a word of the form $w_i w_{i + 1} \dots w_{j - 1} w_j$, for some pair of positive integers $1 \le i \le j \le n$. Show that $w$ has at most $n$ distinct palindromic substrings.\\
\\
For example, $aaaaa$ has $5$ distinct palindromic substrings, and $abcata$ has $5$ ($a$, $b$, $c$, $t$, $ata$).
